subject: Learning
title: Elaborative Retrieval
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Elaborative Retrieval.

hook.text: Instead of recalling 'mitochondria = powerhouse,' explain why cells need energy. That deeper retrieval lasts longer.

buildup.text: Elaborative retrieval means recalling not just facts, but connections, reasons, and examples.

discovery.text: It works because elaboration creates multiple retrieval routes to the same memoryâ€”more paths, more access.

twist.text: Simple fact retrieval strengthens one pathway. Elaborative retrieval builds a network of related memories.

climax.text: Asking 'why' and 'how' during retrieval transforms surface memories into deep, transferable understanding.

punchline.text: Don't just recall the fact. Recall the story around it. Context is memory glue.

quiz.question: How does elaborative retrieval improve memory?
options: It creates multiple retrieval routes by recalling connections, reasons, and examples
It reduces the amount of information you need to remember
Elaboration only works for language learning
